Title: PMI: Business output hits six-month high as private sector growth improves
Summary: Business activities in Nigeria’s private sector strengthened in October, marking the highest output growth in six months . PMI: Business output hits six-month high as private sector growth improves .

Title: Digitisation, sustainability test Nigeria’s corporate governance model
Summary: Nigeria’s corporate governance model is facing a major test of relevance . Experts warned that compliance-based practices are not sustainable in Nigeria .

Title: Insurer applauds Ezeibe’s historic emergence as NCRIB President
Summary: Prudential Zenith Life Insurance congratulates Mrs. Ekeoma Ezeibe on her historic investiture as the 23rd President and third female leader of the Nigerian Council of Registered Insurance Brokers (NCRIB)

Title: Firm spends N45m to train educators on cybersecurity
Summary: Firm, Levi Edu Tech, has equipped 140 teachers on the fundamentals of cybersecurity practices in education . Firm spends N45m to train educators on cybersecurity practices .

Title: NLC urges workers to build political power, seeks radical health sector reform
Summary: NLC urges workers to build political power, seeks radical health sector reform . The Nigeria Labour Congress has urged workers and union leaders to begin building political power .

Title: Cooking gas price defy marketers, sells at N1,200 per kg
Summary: Liquefied Petroleum Gas, LPG, otherwise known as cooking gas, has remained high despite assurances from marketers that product will return to its pre-October price range of N950 to N1,000 per kilogram (kg) A visit to some gas stations in Lagos shows that the product was sold yesterday at between between N

Title: Pension fund investment in FG securities rise 18.1% to N15.8 trn
Summary: Pension Fund’s investments in Federal Government (FG) securities rose by 18.1% Year-on-Year, YoY, in eight months, ended August 2025 to N15.824    trillion . This was disclosed in the latest pension funds industry portfolio report from the National Pension Commission .

Title: Trump: NSA, Service Chiefs meet
Summary: The National Security Adviser, Mallam Nuhu Ribadu, met with service chiefs and heads of security and intelligence agencies over the decision of US President, Donald Trump, to move against Nigeria, following allegation of Christian genocide in the country .

Title: JAMB extends 2025 public universities’ admissions deadline to Nov 17
Summary: The Joint Admissions and Matriculation Board, JAMB, has approved the extension of the 2025 admissions deadline for public universities from Friday, October 31, 2025, to Monday, November 17, 2025 .

Title: Opposition fueling Christian genocide narrative — Wike
Summary: Minister of the Federal Capital Territory (FCT), Nyesom Wike, has dismissed claims of a ‘Christian genocide’ in Nigeria . Wike described the allegation as politically motivated and “a case of politics taken too far”

Title: PDP dead in Ekiti, gov aspirants fooling themselves — Fayose
Summary: Ayodele Fayose has declared that the PDP is “dead” in Ekiti, saying all its governorship aspirants are “fooling themselves” Fayose also lauded Governor Biodun Oyebanji of the All Progressives Congress, predicting a landslide victory for him in the June 20,

Title: Gov poll: Amupitan visits Anambra, parties sign peace accord
Summary: Political parties and their candidates in the November 8, 2025, Anambra State governorship election signed a peace accord on Monday . The peace pact was organised by the Kukah Centre under the auspices of the National Peace Committee, chaired by former Head of State, Gen. Abdulsalami Abubakar (retd

Title: Worker dies after medieval tower partly collapses in Italy
Summary: Romanian national pulled from rubble of medieval tower that partly collapsed in Rome dies . He had been helping to renovate the Torre dei Conti, which partially collapsed shortly before midday Monday . The tower is in a busy area, just off the Imperial Forum and close to the Colosseum, Italy’s top tourist site

Title: Peru cuts diplomatic ties with Mexico over asylum for ex- PM
Summary: Former prime minister Betssy Chavez is being investigated as co-author of the alleged 2022 coup attempt by then president Pedro Castillo . Castillo, a former rural schoolteacher and trade unionist dubbed Peru’s “first poor president,” was impeached by Congress in December 2022 after his attempt to dissolve Congress

Title: ANPP bloc sets tough terms to back Tinubu’s 2027 bid
Summary: The ANPP bloc was one of the legacy blocs that merged to form the ruling All Progressives Congress in 2013 . The group accused the party leadership of sidelining its members in political appointments and influence since the merger . It also decried what he described as the continued exclusion of former ANPP members from key positions in the current administration
